column4: how is networking supposed to work now that I'm in breezy? is it supposed to come up from the 'networking' init script still? How do I configure it with my wireless encryption key etc? does it integrate with Network-Manager or -- how does it work?
anybody update to breezy and lose their synaptic touchpad driver?
it fails to find my touchpad
It fails to find it or it doesn't load a driver for it?
it is gone from lspci?
Where did you see it then?
Which driver is it trying to load for it?
/dev/psaux
...and is that the correct device? (ie. the same device as it used before)
Yes. same as my old xorg.conf
cat /dev/psaux and use your touchpad. If you get lots of characters then it's the right device. If not you might want to look for another device that produces output.
it is the right device
Well, you said that it loaded a driver fine, right?
ie tpconfig found it.
that's the driver it should be using
ldd tpconfig reveals that it doesn't have jack to do with x

Well, if you can make it work in console you should be able to make it work in X. Now, since tpconfig detects that it is a device it probably is so. The best guess I've got is that it's been moved in the /dev tree.
If you've already tried other possible devices there please tell me now. If not please tell me that you don't appreciate my attempts to help you.
I've tried /dev/input/mice .... cat /dev/psaux does produce output when I move my touchpad
there just seems to be something wrong with x's ability to properly identify my touchpad
Well, try using a generic driver for it in xorg.conf
what you mean? my touchpad is working right now... I want to use the synaptics driver
I see. This is a kernel driver, right?
the synaptics_drv.o of which I speak came with x, and resides in /usr/X11R6/lib/modules/input
